ubbhataka： ubbhataka（ti）
ဥဗ္ဘတက（တိ）
«ubbhata+ka»
[ဥဗ္ဘတ+က]

Ubbhataka：A mote-hall built by the Mallas of Pāvā．When it was finished they invited the Buddha to be its first occupant．The Buddha went with the monks and spent the night in the hall．It was on this occasion that Sāriputta recited theSangīti Sutta （D．iii．207ff）．

Buddhaghosa says （DA．iii．971） that the hall was so-called （”Thrown-aloft-er”） because of its great height．

ubbhataka：ဥဗ္ဘတက（တိ）
[ဥဗ္ဘတ+က]
အထက်သို့ တက်-ပေါ်ထွက်လာ-သကဲ့သို့သော၊ မြင့်လှစွာသော၊ ဥဗ္ဘတမည်သော။ （အဆောက်အဦ။လွတ်တော်）။
